title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 8 §§ 79-12.5 - Classifications systems
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 8 §§ 79-12.5 - Classifications systems

State Regulations
A licensed psychoanalyst may use accepted classifications
of signs, symptoms, dysfunctions and disorders, such as the Diagnostic and

Statistical Manual of Mental Disorders, published by the American Psychiatric

Association, or an equivalent classification system as determined by the
department, provided that such use is consistent with the practice of
psychoanalysis as defined in section
8405
(1)
of the Education Law. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 8
§§
79-12.5

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
